unnormalised: ## New Wheels Alert! What's Popping in the Indian Auto Scene?
normalised: ## New Wheels Alert! What's Popping in the Indian Auto Scene?

unnormalised: Namaste, petrolheads! The automotive landscape in India is buzzing like a busy Mumbai street. We've got some seriously exciting vehicle launches to talk about, and trust me, your wallet might start twitching.
normalised: Namaste, petrolheads! The automotive landscape in India is buzzing like a busy Mumbai street. We've got some seriously exciting vehicle launches to talk about, and trust me, your wallet might start twitching.

unnormalised: First up, everyone's been waiting for the Maruti Suzuki Brezza facelift. Rumours are swirling about a hybrid engine and even more features packed in. Expected price? Around Rs. 8 Lakhs onwards. It's looking like a direct competitor to the Tata Nexon, and the battle for the compact SUV crown is ON!
normalised: First up, everyone's been waiting for the Maruti Suzuki Brezza facelift. Rumours are swirling about a hybrid engine and even more features packed in. Expected price? Around rupees eight lakhs onwards. It's looking like a direct competitor to the Tata Nexon, and the battle for the compact S U V crown is ON!

unnormalised: Then, Mahindra is teasing us with their new XUV500 successor, codenamed XUV700. Word on the street (or should I say, on Autocar India) is that it’ll boast advanced driver-assistance systems and a powerful engine. Remember the XUV500 craze? This one’s promising to be bigger and better. Delivery dates are still hazy, but late 2023 seems plausible.
normalised: Then, Mahindra is teasing us with their new X U V five hundred successor, codenamed X U V seven hundred. Word on the street (or should I say, on Autocar India) is that it’ll boast advanced driver-assistance systems and a powerful engine. Remember the X U V five hundred craze? This one’s promising to be bigger and better. Delivery dates are still hazy, but late two thousand twenty three seems plausible.

unnormalised: Speaking of electric, Ola Electric is promising their electric scooter will hit the road by Diwali. Will they finally deliver? Only time will tell. They're promising a range of over 150 km on a single charge. I hope the charging infrastructure catches up because getting stranded in the middle of Gurgaon at night with a dead scooter battery sounds like a scene from a really bad Bollywood comedy!
normalised: Speaking of electric, Ola Electric is promising their electric scooter will hit the road by Diwali. Will they finally deliver? Only time will tell. They're promising a range of over one hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge. I hope the charging infrastructure catches up because getting stranded in the middle of Gurgaon at night with a dead scooter battery sounds like a scene from a really bad Bollywood comedy!

unnormalised: For the premium segment, BMW just launched the updated 5 series. It's got that signature Bimmer appeal, but with a slightly more modern design. Expect to shell out upwards of Rs. 60 Lakhs for this beauty.
normalised: For the premium segment, B M W just launched the updated five series. It's got that signature Bimmer appeal, but with a slightly more modern design. Expect to shell out upwards of rupees sixty lakhs for this beauty.

unnormalised: Finally, a shoutout to all the budding automotive engineers coming out of IIT Bombay! Keep innovating and designing the future of Indian mobility. Who knows, maybe one day we'll all be zipping around in self-driving cars designed right here in India! What launch are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments!
normalised: Finally, a shoutout to all the budding automotive engineers coming out of I I T Bombay! Keep innovating and designing the future of Indian mobility. Who knows, maybe one day we'll all be zipping around in self-driving cars designed right here in India! What launch are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments!
